did.unittitle: Hartford Women's Center Papers

repository.corpname: GLBTQ Archives, Central Connecticut State University

did.abstract: The Hartford Women’s Center (HWC) was organized in October of 1977 to serve women of the city of Hartford. The goal was to create network of organizations with resources for women. Newsletters and calendars were ways to reach out to community. HWC helped to establish first Hartford Feminist Library in 1979. The collection consists of newsletters, minutes, flyers, photographs and slides and extensive correspondence.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: The Hartford Women’s Center (HWC) was organized in October of 1977. The first meeting was held as an open discussion to talk about the creation of a place for women in the city. Fifty women attended that meeting and expressed ideas about wanting social activities, referral services, support groups, art classes, sports, and coordination for all these activities and an emotionally supportive environment. The goal of the center was then to create a network for existing women’s organizations as well as identify new community resources for women and provide a communications network through newsletters and a calendar. Meetings, library space, and social gathering space were held at the Hill Center of Hartford, 350 Farmington Avenue. As part of the Hartford Women’s Project, they shared offices with 13 other women’s organizations at 57 Pratt Street in the city. Irene Scheibner, member of the Hartford Women’s Center and Central Connecticut State University alumni, founded the Hartford Feminist Library in 1979. The library’s purpose was to provide books, periodicals, and information by and about women to the greater Hartford community. The collection housed books regarding topics such as women’s history, women and political theory, Black and Hispanic women, women artists, poets, authors, and non-sexist children’s books.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Subject files, correspondence, notes, flyers, printed material, posters, photographs, newspapers articles, periodicals. 1917; 1970-2003

otherfindaid.head: Other Finding Aids note
otherfindaid.p: Restrictions: Access to financial records restricted until 2015.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation note
prefercite.p: Cite as: Hartford Women's Center records (GLBTQ 2012.01), Special Collections Department, Central Connecticut State University, New Britain.

odd.head: General note
odd.p: Ms. The world of Women is a magzine publisehd in NYC, its contenct relates to women's issues: feminism, health, art, publishing, sexuality, etc.
